info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:30PM EDT until July 23 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN BUTLER...SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...EASTERN ALLEGHENY...WESTERN WESTMORELAND...EASTERN GREENE...SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG AND WESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 330 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Delmont, or 8 miles north of Greensburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Monroeville, Greensburg, McKeesport, Uniontown, Jeannette, Connellsville, Vandergrift, Waynesburg, Apollo, and Plum. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
